snippet: The mortgage company Freddie Mac said Thursday that the nationwide average for a 30-year mortgage declined to 3.89 percent this week from 3.97 percent last week.
abstract: Freddie Mac releases data that shows average long-term mortgage rates in the United States fell for fourth consecutive week, continuing boon for potential home buyers; Labor Dept report number of people seeking unemployment benefits slipped below 300,000.
lead_paragraph: The mortgage company Freddie Mac said Thursday that the nationwide average for a 30-year mortgage declined to 3.89 percent this week from 3.97 percent last week.

headline.main: 30-Year Mortgage Rates in U.S. Fall for 4th Week
headline.print_headline: 30-Year Mortgage Rates in U.S. Fall for 4th Week
